member.name: T:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.UI.Controls.StaggeredLayout
member.summary: Arranges child elements into a staggered grid pattern where items are added to the column that has used least amount of space.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.UI.Controls.StaggeredLayout.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.UI.Controls.StaggeredLayout.DesiredColumnWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired width for each column.
member.remarks: The width of columns can exceed the DesiredColumnWidth if the HorizontalAlignment is set to Stretch.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.UI.Controls.StaggeredLayout.DesiredColumnWidthProperty
member.returns: The identifier for the dependency property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.UI.Controls.StaggeredLayout.ColumnSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the spacing between columns of items.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.UI.Controls.StaggeredLayout.RowSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the spacing between rows of items.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.UI.Controls.StaggeredLayoutState.Clear
member.summary: Clear everything that has been calculated.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.UI.Controls.StaggeredLayoutState.ClearColumns
member.summary: Clear the layout columns so they will be recalculated.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.UI.Controls.StaggeredLayoutState.GetHeight
member.summary: Gets the estimated height of the layout.
member.returns: The estimated height of the layout.
member.remarks: If all of the items have been calculated then the actual height will be returned. If all of the items have not been calculated then an estimated height will be calculated based on the average height of the items.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.UI.Controls.WrapLayout
member.summary: Arranges elements by wrapping them to fit the available space. When is set to Orientation.Horizontal, element are arranged in rows until the available width is reached and then to a new row. When is set to Orientation.Vertical, element are arranged in columns until the available height is reached.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.UI.Controls.WrapLayout.HorizontalSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets a uniform Horizontal distance (in pixels) between items when is set to Horizontal, or between columns of items when is set to Vertical.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.UI.Controls.WrapLayout.VerticalSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets a uniform Vertical distance (in pixels) between items when is set to Vertical, or between rows of items when is set to Horizontal.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Toolkit.Uwp.UI.Controls.WrapLayout.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of the WrapLayout. Horizontal means that child controls will be added horizontally until the width of the panel is reached, then a new row is added to add new child controls. Vertical means that children will be added vertically until the height of the panel is reached, then a new column is added.
